FuncDef:
The maxage-lsa route-calculate-delay command configures a route calculation delay that is triggered when the device receives a MaxAge Router LSA.
The undo maxage-lsa route-calculate-delay command restores the default configuration. The maxage-lsa route-calculate-delay command configures a route calculation delay that is triggered when the device receives a MaxAge Router LSA. The undo maxage-lsa route-calculate-delay command restores the default configuration. By default, the delay time of route calculation is not set. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a route calculation delay that is triggered when the device receives a MaxAge Router LSA.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535, in seconds. The default value is 20 seconds. If the value is set to 0, route calculation is not delayed when the device receives a MaxAge Router LSA.
